Frequently Asked Questions

Got questions about how Meenta works. This is a good starting point. We have collected the most common questions we have received.

Show All
  • My samples require a Custom Read Length. Will you accept my samples for sequencing?

    The Host has the ability to designate whether they accept custom read lengths or not. Just search or the read length you need and Hosts matching your read length will populate.

  • My libraries require a Custom Primer. Will you accept my samples for sequencing?

    Yes. The Host has to designate this capability in their profile. Just search for “customer primer” and matching Hosts will populate matching labs.

  • Can I cancel a sample order?

    For a User Purchasing:

    Yes. If you order a sample you can cancel it without any cost within 24 hours of the order, unless the lane or instrument is marked as ‘non-cancellable’ at the time of checkout.

    For a Host:

    Yes, you can cancel a sample within 24 hours as well from the time of the users purchase.

  • What if Meenta is unable to collect the Hosts genomic service fees?

    This is a very rare occurrence. No, the Host gets paid what Meenta gets paid. We would not reduce the Host genomic service payment due to any collection efforts made by Meenta.

  • Can the Host reject booking request?

    Yes, they can.

  • Will the Host perform pooling?

    No. Hosts only accepted pooled samples…but there are a few exceptions.

  • How are samples submitted/sent?

    Use the sample submission tool during the booking process and use the pre-paid shipping label.

  • How do the Hosts get paid?

    We will pay within 30 days of uploading the data to the Meenta cloud.

  • How do I get my data? What files?

    We will send you an e-mail with a key that will allow you to download the FASQ file from our cloud.

  • How do I pay?

    All Users require either a Credit card or Purchase Order in order to book or make a request. Please make your PO out to; Meenta, 71 Commercial Street, Boston, MA 02109.

  • Do I have to pool my samples?

    Yes, all samples must be pooled and ready to sequence.

  • How does Meenta ensure quality Hosts?

    Yes. The Host has to designate this capability in their profile. Just search for “customer primer” and matching Hosts will populate matching labs.

  • How is data delivered?

    We will send you an e-mail with a key that will allow you to download the FASQ file from our cloud.

  • I need my samples processed immediately. What should I do?

    Use the Instant Book option. this will guarantee a specific run date for your booking. Please make sure your samples arrive at the Host site at least 2 days prior to the run so they can perform QC if required.

  • Is analysis included?

    Not at this time. FASQ files are delivered using our cloud, but check back with us soon.

  • Does Meenta subtract the Host fee from our genomic service price?

    No, the Meenta service fees are invoiced to you as a Host directly every month. This is because some cores have rules for providing constant external pricing to their users, like us, and we want a consistent policy.

  • What is the minimum sample molarity / sample volume requirement for sequencing?

    The Host designates these requirements in their site profile which will be visible to you during the sample submission process.

  • Is there a Meenta service fee for month where no booking are made?

    We only charge a fee when there is a booking.

  • I did the QC, and I don't want to pay for another QC at X institution. Can I opt out?

    The QC that the Host performs is already included in the pricing they display. You may also opt out of QC and request that your sample be run “at risk”, however, the Host has the option to reject these types of samples.

  • Can I get advice about how to perform QC on my samples?

    Yes, but you have to be registered as a User and make sure inquiries through the chat feature in the app.

  • Do you offer QPCR quant services for my library samples?

    No, we do not. At this time we only accept prepped land quantitated libraries.

  • What QC metrics do I have to provide?

    Check the requirements during your sample submission process as each Host site is different.

  • Do I have to perform any QC on my samples?

    Yes, the Host designates their sample submission criteria in their site profile. These will be visible to you as the User during your sample submission process. A Host may also elect to accept your samples “at risk” which would not be covered by the Meenta re0run guarantee.

  • How does instant book differ from another booking?

    There are two ways to ‘book’ lanes on Meenta: Instant Book and Requests. Instant books provide a way to book lanes that are configured and ready. When a host needs to fill a flow cell, they can make lanes available for instant bookings. This means there is no back and forth process, as will happen when a user requests a specific configuration.

    When a host opens a machine up for requests, these provide the user with the ability to request a number of lanes, configurations and dates. The host can then either approve or decline. Unlike an instant book, the user needs to wait for confirmation.

    Rule of Thumb: if you need a sample sequenced ASAP, then look for instant bookings. If you have time, then you can make a request and communicate with a host.

  • Can someone help me determine the best NGS approach for my samples?

    Once you register you can communicate with the Host through our Chat tool.

  • When do I ship my samples?

    For Instant Bookings and Booking Requests all samples must arrive at least 2 business days prior to the booking date.
